meanings.definition: Having a dull, hollow sound when struck.
meanings.sent1: The old drum made a plunky noise when I tapped it.
meanings.sent2: The wooden door had a plunky sound when it closed.
meanings.sent3: The plunky sound of the broken bell made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The plunky raindrops on the tin roof created a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The plunky guitar strings added a unique touch to the song.

meanings.definition: A style of playing music characterized by a percussive, rhythmic quality.
meanings.sent1: The band's music had a plunky vibe that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: She loved the plunky beats of the drums in the song.
meanings.sent3: The plunky music echoed through the hall, making everyone tap their feet.
meanings.sent4: The plunky rhythm of the music was like a heartbeat in the background.
meanings.sent5: The plunky melody of the xylophone was catchy and fun.

meanings.definition: To play music in a lively, rhythmic manner.
meanings.sent1: He plunkily strummed the guitar, filling the room with music.
meanings.sent2: They plunky played the drums at the party, keeping everyone entertained.
meanings.sent3: She plunkily danced around the room, matching the beat of the music.
meanings.sent4: The band plunkily performed on stage, energizing the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The children plunkily sang along to their favorite song, full of joy.
